Key: It's morning... Huh? When did I fall asleep?

*yawn*... I don't remember falling asleep.
What was I up to? I can't seem to recall.

(I gazed around my room, catching my eye
on the calendar. Then...)
Ah. I see. It's my day off.

(Today's my day off. And I promised to go
on a date with Origami.)

(We've once again confessed our feelings
to one another, and now we're officially
going out.)
(Today will be our first date.)
A date with Origami... I feel nervous.

But there's no point in stressing over it.
I'll just go.

Okay. I still have time before we scheduled
to meet.

(I'm about to go on an actual date with Origami.
I don't want to be late to our first date.)

(Origami is... Ah, there she is. I guess she's
already here.)
Morning, Origami.
Shido, morning.
W-Was I keeping you?
Not at all. I just arrived.
...Somehow, I doubt that.
...How did you know?

There's a feather in your hair. You didn't
put this there, did you?
I was playing with pigeons. No big deal.

Playing with pigeons. Man, I'm sorry.
I should've left home earlier.
I don't mind. Pigeons are cute.
I-I see, but you got bored, right?
There is no problem.
O-Okay. If you say so...
Shido, where are we going today?
Huh? Hm...

(I'm on my own for today's date. As Origami's
boyfriend, I have to take the lead in planning.)

(I don't know if I'll be any good at it, but I
can do it.)

Anyways, why don't we head to a café so
we can talk it over? I'm thirsty.

(Origami said it was no problem, but I bet
she's tired. So we need a place where we
can rest.)
Got it.
O-Okay. Then let's go.
...Here?
Sure. Should we... find a seat in the back?

That's no good. I want to be near the entrance.
As security in the worst-case scenario.

Hey, wait, Origami... Who are you fighting
right now?

(Does she have to be on red alert even on
a date with me? Can she not relax around
me?)
Do not fret. Force of habit.

I-I see... Well, we can sit wherever you want,
Origami. Looks like there's plenty of room.
Got it.

Hm, drinks... I'm going to get coffee. What
about you?
Same as what you're having.

G-Gotcha. Then I'll order, okay? Excuse me.
Two coffees, please!
...Urgh.

(Crap. If this silence keeps up, it'll get
awkward. What do I do?)
Do some small talk.
Distract yourself.
Do you visit cafés often, Origami?
Not particularly. I rarely go out alone.
I-I see.
What about you?
Well, I don't go out alone much either.

But you checked your wallet earlier, Shido.
You had a coupon for this soup.
...Huh?

(Oh, crap. I forgot. I usually come here for
private time. I must've gotten the coupon
a while ago.)

(Oof. If she noticed a coupon that I had
forgotten about, then Origami has a good
eye.)

When you say you do not often travel alone,
does that imply you come here with guests?

N-No. I mean, I come here with Kotori
sometimes. Just when we're out.
...I see.

(I think I played it off. I mean, not that it
was a lie.)
(Anyway, I need to change the subject.)

Hm. Do you like eating foods you like
at the beginning of a meal, or do you
save the best parts for last?

I am ambivalent about food. I never think about
the order in which it is consumed. I consume a
well-balanced diet. The rest is habit.

I see, but... Oh, I know. If you're dieting, I hear
it's best to eat veggies first, then move on to
the main dish.

I maintain a careful caloric intake with
nutrient-dense foods, and I exercise enough
not to worry about a diet.
Oh. Right. You're, um, slim, aren't you?

Are you pointing out that I lack a
typically-voluptuous, feminine body?
Oh, no. That's not what I meant.
...I see.

(Urgh. Not only is this awkward, but
this conversation got off on the wrong
foot.)
I-I know, Origami.
What is it?

I know. I think it is about time for my
points to recover.
...What are you talking about?

A game. A mobile game. You need points to
play, but they regenerate after a set amount
of time. I should have enough points now.
We are going to game here?
Yeah. Do you not want to?
Do as you please, Shido.
I'll be done soon, so give me a second.
...Okay.

...You see. They're currently doing an
event. It's hard to raise your affinity
stat.
Affinity?

Yeah. You perform a date quest, gain affinity
points, and obtain a rare heroine card.
...I see.

All right. I used 'em up. Guess I won't be able
to play again until tonight.
Shido, is that fun for you...?
Huh? Oh, yes...

(This is starting to feel like the wrong decision.
I ignored my date, and played a dating game
instead of talking to my DATE.)

Are you not enjoying yourself with me on
this date?

Agh. Well, no, that's not it. Um, it's to learn
how to date.

Learn how to date...? Are you suggesting that
you gain information to use on an actual date?
Y-Yeah... Kinda. Just for reference, though.
...I see.
(Hm. I think I messed that one up.)

So, where are we going next? We have yet
to decide our next move.
Y-Yeah, huh? Uh...
I had the idea of watching a movie.
I do not mind.
O-Okay. Then let's head to the movie theater.

(Origami doesn't look like she's enjoying
herself. I'll have to do better at the next
location.)
...Origami.

This theater has a sign that says they're
temporarily closed.
Sorry... I didn't check ahead of time.

(I should've checked beforehand. I just kinda
assumed the movies would be open on my day
off. Of all the dumb luck...)

It's fine. It's not like there was a movie that I
wanted to watch.
I'm really sorry about this...
I don't mind. So, where to next?
Oh, um...

(Shoot. I wasn't thinking. My mind was still
stuck on that total failure. I have no idea...)

If there is nothing in particular, I have an
idea.
Y-You want to go somewhere?
Follow me.
Oh, hey Origami.
...We're here.
Is this where you wanted to go?
The air is warm, and the breeze is nice.
You're right. It's been chilly lately.

(A perfect Autumn day. Not too hot, not too
cold.)

What a view, huh? Does looking down at the
town like this relax you?
It is quiet, giving us a moment to pause.

(I see. Maybe Origami prefers quaint areas
like this instead of lively ones.)
Can we stay here a while?

Yes, of course. Do you like places like this,
Origami?
What's the matter?
...I do not like it in particular.
Huh? Oh, really?
In truth, the location does not matter.

I-I see. Is it because of the nice weather that
you preferred being outside instead of indoors?
Or was it the quiet?
No. What matters is that I am with you.
Oh...

No matter where I am, so long as you are with
me, I enjoy it. The place is irrelevant.
Origami...

But...there is a reason I chose this place. Here,
I can look at you and take my time.

I see. Well, I guess there aren't nearly as many
people here as in the café, so we can chat,
right?
And we can do more than that.
Origami, this is still a public place.
Then, shall we sit on a bench?
Yeah, sure.

If you want, you can place your head on my
lap.

No, there are other people around... Let's
sit normally, okay...
...Okay.

(We were at Takadai Park and chatted,
enjoying one another's company.)

(Although I wanted to take Origami somewhere,
it seems more like she's taking me instead.)

(Well, maybe I can suggest something she
will enjoy.)

Do you want to drop by the arcade on our
way back, Origami?
I do not mind.
Let's go then.
All right. This one...
A crane game...

Yeah. I'm pretty good at these. Since we're on
a date, I thought I could win you something.
A gift from Shido... How nice.

Yeah. Anything catch your eye, Origami? I'll
get whatever you want.

...I don't mind what it is. As long as it comes
from you, Shido.

Okay. I'll get the biggest one. Hehehe.
Watch this...
...Huh? Weird.
One more time...
Argh! So close. O-One more time...
Almost there! One more time.
Shido... Might it be the key holder there?
Huh?
Okay, this is the one!
...Hehe.
...Shido?
Origami, I did it... I finished!

(After using countless coins, I gave up and
aimed for a small key holder, trying so many
times to capture it.)

(It was a pathetic showing for one key holder,
but then a miracle happened...)

(It was a double! I didn't think I'd catch the
one beside it...!)

(Two key holders fell. All thanks to Origami,
who pointed out the one in the middle.)
Sorry, Origami. It's not the one I aimed for.
I'm happy. You tried for my sake.
Haha... You're making me blush.
But... I don't need two.
...Huh?
I want you to keep the other one.
Oh, got it. I'll put it on my bag.
I'll put it in the same place. We're matching.
We are.
(Finally, we were on our way back.)

(Origami was her usual self, walking beside
me with a stoic expression.)

(Both of us were quiet. Silence makes me
nervous. Origami didn't look upset, but
I can't tell if she's having a good time.)

(I wonder if I'm doing this right. But I can't
think in those terms. I mean, I hardly did a
thing right today. I wonder if she had fun.)
Origami...?
What is it, Shido?

Um, sorry about today. You didn't have much
fun, did you?
...Why do you say that?
Well, you didn't look like you enjoyed yourself.

I... I'm not used to dates. So I wasn't sure if I
was doing a good job or not.

So, um, sorry for dragging you around on your
day off.
I don't know what you're talking about.
Well, you see...
Shido, come here...
...What is it?
Just do it.
O-Okay. Like this?
Give me your hand.
O-Origami?!

(Origami took my hand and placed it against
her chest, a very soft place... so that I could
feel her heartbeat.)
What... are you doing?!
Shido, there is nothing for you to worry about.
Huh?
Can't you tell? My heart is racing right now.
Is it... because you're nervous?

That's right. Just being with you makes my
heart pound.
I-I see, but still...

I want you to feel it. Just being with you
is enough to put me in this state, Shido.

I may not express it with my words, my
expressions, or my emotions, but this
is proof enough. Shido, can you trust me?
Well, um, I don't know if this is okay...

(Her clothes felt nice, and I could feel her
warmth. She was so soft that I thought I would
melt any moment.)
Shido, can you tell?

(The bump I felt beneath my hand slowly
bobbed up and down in sync with her
breathing.)
Can you feel how quickly my heart is beating?
I-I know... I know...

(I'm the one whose heart is about to pound
real fast. I could feel my blush reach the tops
of my ears.)

(Actually, before I noticed Origami's heartbeat,
I was disoriented by the loudness of my own.)
(What should I do...?)
Stay like this.
Remove my hand.
Uh, um, is it okay to stay like this for a bit?
I don't mind.
Oh, okay...
(What am I even saying?! That's crazy!)
You can grab harder.
Huh? Oh...

(Origami grabbed my hand, and pressed it
into her body.)
Shido, your hand is... very hot.
W-Well, I can explain...

(I thought I would melt at any moment from
how soft she felt. I felt an electric hum travel
through my body.)
Shido, touch me more...
O-Origami, n-no, we can't... We can't do this...!

(It's like I'm absorbing Origami's heat.
I became dizzy, like I was on the cusp of
overheating.)

(I couldn't take anymore. I pulled my hand
away from Origami.)
Shido...?
I-I got it... I really get it now.

But Origami, we can't do this here. What
would you do if someone saw?
I do not mind...
Well, I do! Besides...

(Besides, the marshmallow-like feeling, the
sweet, sugary warmth.... is almost too much
to bear.)
A-Anyway, I don't think this is appropriate!
Oh...
(I withdrew my hand from Origami.)
Shido...
Sorry, Origami. This is too much for me.

I am your girlfriend, Shido. You do not have
to hesitate.
I know that, but I don't think it's appropriate.

Why? Don't you like me? Do you not wish
to go out with me?
That's not it... That's not it, Origami.

Then, why do you have a problem with
touching me...?
B-Because it feels wrong.

Then, why? I want you to know more about
me. I want you to get closer... and feel me.

I-I don't know how to explain it, but... I don't
think this is appropriate.
Appropriate? Do you not wish to touch me?
No, no. That's not what I'm saying.

Why not then? If it is you, I do not mind where
you touch me or what you do to me.

I find myself always wanting to touch your
body. I want to feel every part of you.
Do you not feel the same...?
I-I do, but still... It's not right.
What do you mean?

You're precious to me, Origami. Because of that,
I don't want to rush into anything.

It's hard to explain, but I feel like touching
you here out of the blue just feels wrong.
So what are you saying?
Well...
Does forbidden temptation excite you?
NO! NOT IN THE SLIGHTEST!

Then, you refuse to let me stimulate you?
Do I not qualify as your girlfriend?

No, it's the opposite. I don't like the thought
of looking at you in a perverted way.

It's hard to explain, but I don't want you to
feel like I'm only seeing you for the purpose
of expecting something in return.

But I do not mind. It is normal for a man
of your age. If it is coming from you Shido,
it makes me happy.

I might sound selfish, but I'm serious...
I want to see you in a more serious way.
I want to hold onto what we have.
...Shido?

Or else, I feel like my feelings for you won't
be real. The thought scares me. I don't want
to rush anything. For now, at least...
I see...
Is that a problem for you?
I understand what you mean. I agree.
I-I'm glad. Do you understand?

Basically, you want no one to see what we do.
Not in a random street. But if we are alone in a
closed room, you want to play with me, yes?
NO! Let's dial it back a bit!
...I am joking. I understand.
Are you sure...?
(For some reason I do not trust her...)
Your sense of virtue is solid.

Yeah...? Seems like if we added ourselves
together and divided the results in half,
we'd be perfect.
That may be true.

Anyway, I want to respect you... That's what I
had wanted to say.

That is sweet of you to say. I will try my best
to abide by your request.

I-I see. I've had a lot of fun, so why don't we
call it a day?
...Understood. Let's leave it here for today.
...Right. Let me walk you.

I'm fine. I don't need it. Your home and mine
are in the opposite directions. It is a waste of
your time.
No, but...
No problem. I will see you tomorrow.
Oh, okay. Tomorrow.

(Is she sure she doesn't want me to escort
her?)

(As I posed the question to myself, Origami
took one step, then turned around to face me.)
...Shido.
What is it...?

Do not forget one thing. So long as we are
together, that is all that matters.
Yeah, I got that. Understood.
That is all. Good night.
O-Okay.
Good-bye, Shido.
L-Later, Origami.

(It was our first date since we became official.
Was that okay...? As soon I was alone, I became
incredibly anxious.)

(Am I kind enough to Origami? Is she having a
good time? Is she feeling anxious, too? Am I
really worthy of her love...?)
Hehe... Hahaha...

(But soon, it all felt so silly. I really like
Origami. I'm crazy about her.)

(I need to communicate those feelings more.
We just parted ways, but I already want to
see her again.)

(I'm going to do better on our next date.
That's what I told myself.)
